result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Thomas Michels is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: $250.00 Bond moved to case 22CM264 from case 22CM380. arc

9:16 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Aaron Thomas Michels in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Aaron Thomas Michels.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CM264 & 22CM380.  Atty Chapman recites joint agreement.  ADA Becker agrees and states victim rights were taken into consideration, notes matter in Dunn county will not be referred as Bail Jumping.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2- Criminal Damage to Property and Ct 3- Disorderly Conduct in 22CM264.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 & 3 in 22CM264.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 22CM264, Court reads in and dismisses Count 1 for restitution purposes only in 22CM380 and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CM380. Court reserves on restitution, parties to schedule hearing with Court Commissioner for restitution hearing.  If the Agent recommends early discharge from probation the Court will consider it. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 22CM264

S/W of 18 months Probation is concurrent on both counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $ 243.00    
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00
 Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- Restitution- Reserved for 60 days

Court Orders: Ct 3 in 22CM264

S/W of 18 months Probation is concurrent on both counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $ 243.00    
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00
 Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- If agent deems necessary, obtain anger management assessment and follow through
- Participate in Victim Impact Panel through Restorative Justice
- No Contact with Thomas Apel and Kevin Berg
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation today, 10/26/22

Credit for 8 days against ultimate sentence

DE to continue making payments to current payment plan until told otherwise. 

Adjourned at 9:39 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km
Per EFV.  gll
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kevin B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court reviews PFAC and finds DE is eligible. Bond argument; bond ordered. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court judiciall transfers to Branch 3 and sets PTC with Branch 3.
